Given the catastrophic situation that has developed at the Azovstal metallurgical plant, as well as being guided by purely humane principles, the Russian Armed Forces offer militants of nationalist battalions and foreign mercenaries from 06:00 (Moscow time) on April 17, 2022 to stop any hostilities and lay down their arms. All who lay down their arms are guaranteed the preservation of life. Once again we call on the official authorities of Kyiv to show prudence, give appropriate instructions to the militants to stop the senseless resistance and leave the center of resistance. But realizing that they will not receive such orders and commands from the Kiev authorities, we urge them to make such a decision on their own and lay down their arms. In addition, we appeal to all military personnel of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and foreign mercenaries – with the cynical attitude of the Kiev authorities, such an unenviable fate awaits all of you. With this in mind, do not tempt your fate following the example of the Mariupol tragedy, but make the only right decision to stop hostilities and lay down your arms now, wherever your “curators” force you to fight for the ideas of Nazism. At the same time, the Russian Federation guarantees to each of you the preservation of life and compliance with all the norms of the Geneva Convention on the treatment of prisoners of war, as it already happened with your comrades who had previously surrendered in Mariupol.

📍 Free the hostages held by the Uk Nazis in a Turkish mosque LINK

In the course of offensive actions to liberate the city of Mariupol, at the request of Turkish President R. Erdogan, on April 16, a special operation was carried out by Russian forces in the Primorsky district to free the hostages held by the Ukrainian Nazis in a Turkish mosque – Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation As a result of the selfless actions of the Russian special forces group, the mosque was released, 29 militants were killed, including foreign mercenaries. The hostages, citizens of one of the CIS countries, were released and taken to a safe place.

The Russian Defense Ministry, after calling on the militants of nationalist formations and foreign mercenaries blocked at Azovstal to surrender on Sunday morning, publishes an algorithm of actions: Since 5.00 a continuous connection is established between the Russian and Ukrainian sides for the exchange of information; From 5.30 am, militants of nationalist battalions and foreign mercenaries – on the one hand, the Russian Armed Forces, together with the military formations of the DPR – on the other hand, declare a “complete silence regime”; At 06:00, both sides will mark the actual beginning of the “silence regime” by raising flags: from the Russian side – red, from the Ukrainian side – white around the entire perimeter of Azovstal; From 6.00 to 13.00 Moscow time – the exit of all without exception Ukrainian armed units and foreign mercenaries, without any weapons and ammunition.

1506 The cornerstone of the current St. Peter’s Basilica is laid in the Vatican by Pope Julius II 1775 Paul Revere and William Dawes ride from Charlestown to Lexington warning the “regulars are coming!” 1783 American Revolution: George Washington issues General Order announcing the end of hostilities with Britain, giving thanks to the Almighty, and offering congratulations and authorizing an extra ration of alcohol to the troops to celebrate 1906 San Francisco earthquake and fire kills nearly 4,000 while destroying 75% of the city 1912 Cunard liner RMS Carpathia brings 705 survivors from the RMS Titanic to New York City 1943 Operation Vengeance: US Army Air Force P-38G fighter aircraft from Guadalcanal. An ambush and shoot down the transport bomber aircraft of Isoroku Yamamoto, commander-in-chief of the Imperial Japanese Navy and mastermind behind the Pearl Harbor attack 1946 International Court of Justice opens at The Hague Netherlands 1958 A United States federal court rules that poet Ezra Pound is to be released from an insane asylum. 1968 178,000 employees of US Bell Telephone System go on strike 1968 London Bridge is sold to US oil company (to be erected in Arizona) 1973 US Government ends Mandatory Oil Import Program, established in 1959 by President Eisenhower 1990 Supreme Court rules states could make it a crime to possess or look at child pornography, even in one’s home 1991 US Census Bureau said it failed to count up to 63 million in 1990 census 2007 The Supreme Court of the United States upholds the Partial-Birth Abortion Ban Act in a 5-4 decision

Tax Day doesn’t usually spark much joy. Although Form 1040 appears shorter nowadays, filing taxes remains way too complicated for most Americans to do alone. It wasn’t always this way. The IRS didn’t appear on the scene until 1862. That’s when the federal government began “to assess, levy, and collect taxes through its power to seize property and income.” Easter Monday is the last day of celebrations of the holy week before the working week resumes. It began in the 15th century.

Following the Crucifixion and Resurrection from the dead, Jesus remained on Earth for 40 days, during which he appeared before the believers, healed the sick, and spread the message of God.

Jesus’s acts also contributed to the first establishment of the church. It is believed Jesus ascended to the heavens after the 40 days following his Resurrection.

The book of Job deals with a subject no one wants to think about – when we are tested or tried. Thinking about Job, we need to remember that God has declared the end from the beginning (Isaiah 41:26). He knows how everything will work out. But we need to remember that God may remove His protective hand for a season. As a result, we may go through trials or tests, times of uncertainty, or circumstances we may not desire. As Job learned, He may allow Satan to interfere for a season. But he only can act to the degree God allows. And He provides the limits. Like Job, we might wonder at times whether God has forsaken us, if we have done something wrong, or if we are being punished unfairly. When we go through tests, we must remember that God remains on the throne. The Bible tells us to “consider it all joy … when you encounter various trials.” When our faith is tested, we gain endurance. If we persevere, we will become “complete, lacking in nothing” (James 1:2-4). Job passed his test, and God brought him even greater blessings. Are you going through tests or trials? Do you feel stretched? Remember, God looks at your heart to see how you respond. Stay faithful in every situation. Continue to trust Him! Be confident that God is on the throne. Persevere! He will strengthen and reward you.

♟ StateCraft RoundTable

The Side of the PTA You Never Knew About
